page.title: 08VILLAGES IN GENERAL
page.content: Villages in the area are usually sparse and lowly populated, appart from villages on the main road, whose population is bigger. The population of the villages that are not on the main road usually are farmers or work as laborers. The houses of the villages on the main road are usually used as holiday cottages. In winter villages can be cut off because of snow drifts and ice. Isolated villages get cut off for about 2 days every year but every so often there is a bad spell and even the villages on the main road get cut off for about a week. This last happened in the winter of 1981. Since the villages are about 12 miles away from Hereford, the price of food .etc. is very expensive, and new products arrive late.
